description:
This Digital Deluxe Edition release of Demon's Souls remake includes:

  • Demon's Souls game
  • Legendary Hero Soul
  • Renowned Warrior Soul
  • Storied Warrior Soul
  • Red-Eye Knight Armor
  • Boletarian Royalty Armor
  • Ritual Blade
  • Hoplite Shield
  • Ring of Longevity
  • Preservation Grain
  • Phosphorescent Grains
  • Bearbug Grains
  • Large Hardstone Shard
  • Moonlightstone Shard
  • Original soundtrack

Additionally, pre-order of any edition of Demon’s Souls also adds Reaper Scythe weapon.
title: Demon's Souls (Digital Deluxe Edition)

description:
Demon's Souls is an action RPG focusing on brutal hack-and-slash gameplay in a fantasy world and a high difficulty level with few introductions. It is a remake of the 2009 game of the same name. It stays faithful to the original vision, only adding smaller additions and changes to the gameplay, but visually redone entirely including new motion capture animations. The game can be run in a Cinematic mode with 30FPS and a native 4K resolution or a Performance mode with 60FPS and a dynamic 4K resolution.

Character customization has been expanded with more options. New elements include armor, rings and weapons. There are also new items called Grains providing temporary resistance against various ailments. The carry capacity and encumbrance system has been revised, for instance to reduce the amount of grasses the character can carry as healing items and more weight assigned to potent ones. The game can now be paused and a Photo mode is available. There is also a Fractured World option that reverses the environment layout. The original score was redone entirely now utilizing a choir and a full orchestra. The voice acting was redone as well. The DualSense's haptic features are used to provide aid in timing parries and the feeling of striking metal.

Online multiplayer is kept intact with cooperative play through the summoning of other players. Competitive gameplay is done through invasions using the Black Eye Stone item. Blood Messages can be left on the ground for other players through an asynchronous multiplayer feature. They can be used for misdirection, to points to secret items or to warn for ambushes. Blood Messages can be recommended by other players and the more recommendations a message receives, the longer in the remain in other players' worlds. A recommendation also heals the player's character who left it.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen
Gameplay
The dragon then flies away shortly after encountering it first time
Entering the fissure
A fierce dragon awaits at the Gates of Boletaria!

title: Demon's Souls

description:
The PlayStation 5 console was launched pre-loaded with the game Astro's Playroom starring the Astro Bot character first introduced in the 2018 PS4 PSVR title Astro Bot: Rescue Mission. This 3D platformer starts in a hub world called CPU Plaza from where four worlds can be explored: GPU Jungle, Cooling Springs, SSD Speedway and Memory Meadow, each based on PS5’s console components. In that way the game is used as an introduction to the features of the PS5, such as experiments with the adaptive triggers, the haptic features through DualSense or the 3D audio of the Tempest engine.

Two other locations are also available from CPU Plaza: Network Speed Run with unlockable time trials and PlayStation Labo where all collectables are stored. Astro Bot can move around freely, jump, hover, punch objects and enemies, and charge a punch for a spin attack. Each world is split up in four levels each. Next to the regular levels there are some where Astro Bot has access to a power suit with new abilities, usually tied capabilities of the DualSense controller.

The game contains many references to game franchises and the legacy of the PlayStation console. A fifth world with a final boss fight is unlocked after completing the first four.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen
That plane works as a bridge
Launch site
Running into Solid Snake hiding under the cardboard box
That over there is Cloud's sword from Final Fantasy VII

title: PlayStation 5 (included game)

alternate_titles.title: Maiden: Resident Evil Village Visual Demo

description: Unlike in Resident Evil: Village where the protagonist is Ethan, the main character from Resident Evil 8, Maiden features different protagonist, an unknown maiden whose goal is to try and escape the dungeon. This game doesn't feature any direct fighting but does feature unique story and content that complements the main game in a similar fashion that Kitchen did for RE7.

sample_screenshots.caption: Whoever is taking care of all the wine in here... or if this really wine in those bottles
There's a piece of clothes burning in the fireplace
Lady of the house won't let us escape
A shelf with medicine
Main menu

title: Maiden

description:
Destruction AllStars is a vehicular arena combat game for up to sixteen players online. It is a PS5 exclusive and was made available for free at launch through the PlayStation Plus program. Players wreck each other in cars in arenas filled with obstacles, ramps and pits, but can also leave the vehicle to move and fight on foot or enter a new vehicle. There are no weapons or power-ups to pick up, attacking can only be done by hitting directly.

While on foot characters can move, jump and have a barge attack as well as a breaker - an on-foot super that provides double jump, a speed boost and a strong ability unique for each of the sixteen available characters. Characters can also jump and hang on to cars, and be shaken off. Cars are not unique to a specific character. The vehicles are divided into light, medium and heavy classes.

There are four multiplayer modes. In single-player there is an Arcade mode, a Practice mode and mode where games can be customized. In single-player the game is played against bots. Using the in-game currency or real money through in-app purchases skins, emotes, vehicle emotes and shouts can be unlocked. There is a Challenge Series mode with seven challenges divided over the available game modes, with story elements and cut-scenes showing clashes between two characters. The first is available for free, but the other series can only be bought using real money. There is support for voice chat.
title: Destruction AllStars

description: Final Fantasy VII: Remake - Intergrade (Digital Deluxe Edition) is a special edition of Final Fantasy VII: Remake - Intergrade which includes the base game Final Fantasy VII: Remake, the DLC Final Fantasy VII: Remake - Episode INTERmission (new story content featuring Yuffie), a digital Artbook and the digital Mini-Soundtrack.

description:
Who Wants to Be a Millionaire: New Edition is an updated version of Who Wants to Be a Millionaire released in 2020 and the first release of the game for the PS5. The additional content for this edition includes:

  • 3,000+ new questions
  • New question parks (e.g. Olympic Games, Justice League ...)
  • An option to remove the timer allowing everyone to take the time they need to submit their final answer
  • A new "quick game" mode focusing only on questions and answers letting players reach the million faster.
  • Enhanced models and animations

At the time of the release, it was announced the additional content would also come to the initial release of the game for other platforms.
title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire: New Edition
World of Warships: Legends - PS5 Leprechaun's Secret

description: Endzone: A World Apart - Survivor Edition is the console version of the 2020 title Endzone: A World Apart. It features a fully overhauled UI adjusted for controllers and includes the Endzone: A World Apart - Prosperity DLC.
title: Endzone: A World Apart - Survivor Edition

description:
Tennis On-Court is a tennis VR sports game. With the motion tracking of the controllers, players can reproduce the different ball effects. Some training modes (forehand, backhand, smash, volley, service) are available to learn and progress.

To play a match against an AI, you can choose one of the four difficulty levels (beginner, normal, hard, pro). In online mode, you can play singles or doubles match with your friends but also with players around the world thanks to matchmaking. After each match, you get your new rank in the global leaderboard. When you don't play, you can watch a live match with the spectator mode.
title: Tennis On-Court

description: Firewall: Ultra is the second Firewall title, made exclusively for PlayStation VR2. Players pick-up their guns and work together with a maximum of seven friends to clears objectives. Taking place five years after the original, players return to familiar locations to fulfil new contracts.
title: Firewall: Ultra

description:
This Digital Deluxe Edition includes:

  • Marvel Spider-Man 2
  • five suits each for Peter Parker and Miles Morales
  • 5 skill points
  • early unlocks for the Arachknight and Shadow-Spider Suits, their color variations, and the Web Grabber gadget

title: Marvel Spider-Man 2 (Digital Deluxe Edition)

description: The Launch Edition of Marvel Spider-Man 2 is the pre-order retail copy of the game. It includes the base game and a DLC code to unlock the Arachknight and Shadow-Spider Suits (and their color variations) and the Web Grabber gadget early, along with three skill points.
title: Marvel Spider-Man 2 (Launch Edition)

description:
The Digital Deluxe Upgrade for Marvel Spider-Man 2 contains all of the extra content from the Digital Deluxe Edition. This includes the digital pre-order bonus/physical Launch Edition content; applying this upgrade to either version doesn't duplicate any of the content. Thus, the upgrade provides:

  • five skins each for Peter Parker and Miles Morales
  • two skill points
  • additional photo mode items
  • early access to the Arachknight and Shadow-Spider Suits and their color variations*
  • early access to the Web Grabber gadget*
  • three additional skill points*

"*" indicates the pre-order bonuses
title: Marvel Spider-Man 2: Digital Deluxe Upgrade

description:
Stellar Blade is a singleplayer hack-and-slash game set in a future in which Earth has been overrun by monstrous aliens known as the Naytibas. The player controls EVE, a sword-wielding female supersoldier whose squad is dispatched to Earth from a colony ship on a mission to capture or kill the elder Naytiba controlling much of the planet. After crash-landing, EVE must rendezvous with the surviving members of her squad and forge alliances with the survivors on the surface to complete her mission.

The player controls EVE from a behind-view perspective and can perform quick and heavy attacks as well as parry enemy attacks. Landing a hit on an enemy or parrying fills EVE's Beta Gauge, which allows her to perform a much stronger attack. Later in the game, EVE gains access to other weapons including a variety of guns and grenades as well as a Burst Gauge which can be filled by evading attacks. The Burst Gauge allows EVE to perform special abilities, such as the ability to pierce super armor or interrupt enemy combos.

Throughout their journey, the player can visit camps to save their progress, upgrade skills, and purchase items such as health potions and weapons. EVE's weapon and equipment loadout can be customized to suit different playstyles and her appearance can be changed by applying different skins and cosmetic items.
title: Stellar Blade
Stellar Blade: Digital Deluxe Edition Upgrade
